{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3494588,"name":"Batu Altınay","username":"BatuZ8557","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/batuz8557/{size}/269179_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-28T10:46:34.782Z","cooked":"

İf motor controllers can run 60A continously why first set Max battery capacity to 24Ah and develope 60A Snap action fuses so we can see a speedy season

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-01-28T10:46:34.782Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":100,"readers_count":99,"score":20.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":483949,"topic_slug":"capacity-upgrade-on-power-group-elements","display_username":"Batu Altınay","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68657,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CANERROR"},"post_url":"/t/capacity-upgrade-on-power-group-elements/483949/1","custom_user_title":"CANERROR","reactions":[{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3494595,"name":"Brad","username":"Bmongar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-28T11:13:11.207Z","cooked":"

I don’t work for first so my answers are only speculation.

  1. Challenge. One of the engineering challenges is doing everything you want to do under the power budget.
  2. Cost, higher capacity batteries cost more and some teams struggle with the cost of the 17ah batteries
  3. Field safety and robot safety. First has already gone to some lengths to slow the game down to protect the field and the robots, not sure why they would up the power to undermine this effort.
  4. Weight a 24Ah battery weighs 5-6lbs more than a 17Ah. That will have to come out of the robot weight as the total robot + battery + bumper is targeted to be 150 or less to be a ‘safe’ 2 person lift.
